result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noel Talavera

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 24, 2023 at 09:45 am.

8:59 AM Defendant Noel Talavera in court.  Attorney David Saldana in court for Noel Talavera.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter services provided by Daniel Lopez. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defense has not had communication from the State. Seeking another status date. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Noel Talavera appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl appeared by video for Noel Talavera. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
